description.en: The course introduces mathematical methods (matrix algebra, differential and integral calculus, optimisation, differential and difference equations, phase diagrams) used in models of economics and knowing of which is needed for understanding of economics textbooks and scientific articles. Mathematical methods considered are illustrated with the examples form economics covering statics, comparative statics and dynamics. The aim of the course is not a perfect analysis and interpretation of models used as an example, the latter will be the topic of further courses.
description.et: Kursus tutvustab teoreetilistes majandusmudelites kasutatavaid matemaatilisi meetodeid (maatriksalgebra, diferentsiaal- ja integraalarvutus, optimeerimine, diferentsiaal- ja diferentsvõrrandid, faasidiagrammid), mille tundmine on vajalik majandusteaduslike õpikute ning teadusartiklite mõistmiseks. Käsitletavate matemaatiliste meetodite kasutusvõimalusi majandusteaduses illustreerivad näited majandusteooriast hõlmates nii staatilist, võrdlev-staatilist kui ka dünaamilist analüüsi. Sealjuures ei ole eesmärgiks näitena kasutatud majandusmudelite täielik analüüs ja tõlgendamine, viimast tehakse järgmiste kursuste käigus.

objectives.en: The course advances student's skills and knowledge about different mathematical methods, illustrating them with the help of applications in economics
objectives.et: Kursus täiendab tudengi oskusi ja teadmisi erinevate matemaatiliste meetodite kohta näitlikustades neid kasutusvõimaluste abil majandusteoreetilistes mudelites

learning_outcomes.en: Student, who has passed the course

* knows different, both simple and more complex, mathematical methods; (differentiating, integrating, optimizing, matrix algebra, difference equations, differential equations, phase diagrams; statics, comparative statics, dynamics);
learning_outcomes.et: * tunneb erinevaid, nii lihtsaid kui keerulisemaid, matemaatilisi meetodeid (diferentseerimine, integreerimine, optimeerimine, maatriksarvutus, diferentsvõrrandid, diferentsiaalvõrrandid, faasidiagrammid; staatiline, võrdlev-staatiline ja dünaamiline analüüs);

learning_outcomes.en: * understands the essence of different methods;
* is able to see possibilities to use these methods for analysing different models;
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab näha erinevate meetodite kasutusvõimalusi erinevate mudelite analüüsimisel;

learning_outcomes.en: * is able to choose an appropriate mathematical method for analysing the model and to use this method;
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab valida mudeli analüüsimiseks sobiva matemaatilise meetodi ning seda kasutada;

learning_outcomes.en: * is able to interpret the results of the analysis.

notes.et: NB!!!! FOR THE INFORMATION ABOUT THE COURSE IN A PARTICULAR SEMESTER, SEE "IMPORTANT INFORMATION.PDF" UNDER STUDY MATERIALS

description.et: Three tests, all give max. 20 points. Feedback in the form of discussion of common mistakes is given in the last lecture.
Written exam gives max. 60 points. The final grade is based on the tests and exam as described.

grade_evaluation.et: Every test gives max. 20 and the exam gives max. 60 points, the final grade will be based on the sum of the points from the the two better tests and exam (max. 100 points) in a following way: .: A - 90-100% of the maximum, B - 80-90%, C - 70-80%, D - 60-70%, E - 50-60%, F - below 50%.

debt_elimination.et: There will be no make-up tests for any reason (the only possibility is the time and place announced). There will be one resit for the exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
